title: How to Make Peppermint Rice Krispie Treats

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a large saucepan.
steps.description: Over a low heat setting, melt the butter to where it is nearly all liquid.

steps.headline: Add the marshmallows.
steps.description: Combine and stir the butter and marshmallows until everything is melted thoroughly. Remove the pan from the heat and add the peppermint extract.

steps.headline: Add and fold in the cereal.
steps.description: As you stir, it may become a challenge to get the cereal coated.

parts.name: Setting and Cutting the Rice Krispies Treats

steps.headline: Set the Rice Krispies.
steps.description: Spread the mixture in a 9"x13" greased baking dish. Use a greased spatula to quickly evenly spread it around.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate.
steps.description: Use 30 second intervals to melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl. Stir between heating.

steps.headline: Spread the chocolate over the Rice Krispies.
steps.description: Use a spatula or the back of a spoon to evenly spread it around.

steps.headline: Garnish the Rice Krispies.
steps.description: Use the crushed peppermint candy canes and evenly sprinkle them around.

steps.headline: Chill the mixture.
steps.description: Use plastic wrap to securely cover it. Refrigerate the Rice Krispies for about 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Cut the treats into squares.
steps.description: Use a sharp, clean knife to cut them into even squares.

text: Making the Rice Krispies Treats Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Over a low heat setting, melt the butter to where it is nearly all liquid. Add the marshmallows. Combine and stir the butter and marshmallows until everything is melted thoroughly. Remove the pan from the heat and add the peppermint extract. Add and fold in the cereal. As you stir, it may become a challenge to get the cereal coated. Setting and Cutting the Rice Krispies Treats Set the Rice Krispies. Spread the mixture in a 9"x13" greased baking dish. Use a greased spatula to quickly evenly spread it around. Melt the chocolate. Use 30 second intervals to melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl. Stir between heating. Spread the chocolate over the Rice Krispies. Use a spatula or the back of a spoon to evenly spread it around. Garnish the Rice Krispies. Use the crushed peppermint candy canes and evenly sprinkle them around. Chill the mixture. Use plastic wrap to securely cover it. Refrigerate the Rice Krispies for about 30 minutes. Cut the treats into squares. Use a sharp, clean knife to cut them into even squares.
